1. Overview

This module documents the relationship between the Casimir effect, vacuum field behavior, and neutrino threading through dimensional membranes. In the NEXAH‚ÄìCODEX, this model bridges micro-oscillatory forces and macrofield coherence.

‚∏ª

2. Casimir Effect (Quantum Vacuum Pressure)

Two uncharged plates in a vacuum experience an attractive force due to suppressed modes of vacuum energy between them.

Casimir force formula:
F = -\frac{\pi^2 \hbar c}{240 a^4}
Where:
	‚Ä¢	F = force per unit area
	‚Ä¢	\hbar = reduced Planck constant
	‚Ä¢	c = speed of light
	‚Ä¢	a = plate separation

The Casimir force scales with 1 / a^4 ‚Äî highly sensitive to boundary compression.

‚∏ª

3. Neutrino Flow Model

Neutrinos in the Codex system are modeled as:
	‚Ä¢	ultra-fine, ultra-fast resonance filaments
	‚Ä¢	phase-independent (non-localized)
	‚Ä¢	field-coherent

They can pass through Casimir membranes, but their distribution is modulated by field topology.

‚∏ª

	‚Ä¢	Interlayer coherence

‚∏ª

5. Mathematical Thread Sketch

We define a neutrino resonance flow \Psi_{\nu} modulated by Casimir gradient C(x):

\Psi_{\nu}(x) = A \cdot \sin(\phi x + \omega t) \cdot e^{-\gamma C(x)}

Where:
	‚Ä¢	A = amplitude
	‚Ä¢	\phi = wave vector
	‚Ä¢	\omega = temporal frequency
	‚Ä¢	\gamma = boundary damping coefficient
	‚Ä¢	C(x) = Casimir compression map

The exponential damping term reflects Casimir field suppression.
